overview: Acclaimed flamenco choreographer and dancer Fuensanta  La Moneta is working on a new show when one of her  students gives her a copy of Félix Grande’s poetry collection  La cabellera de la Shoá. Written by Grande after his visit  to Auschwitz, Fuensanta can’t stop thinking about those  women —Jewish and Gypsy alike— who lost their lives in  the concentration camp. The poems inspire her to create a  piece that remembers these women through music, dance  and poetry.
title: Facing the Silence
